definition: he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏他專心一志地做生意，在幾年中就賺到許多錢。

sentences.english: John has a windfall . It surprises his wife greatly .
sentences.chinese: 約翰意外獲得一筆財富，使他夫人大喫一驚。

sentences.english: He self-reflected and decided to decrease the stress and clean up his diet, looking beyond the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 他能自我反醒並決定減少壓力和調整飲食，改變現狀。

sentences.english: I closed the window. I combed his long, black hair from his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 我關上窗，爲他梳理了額頭長長的黑髮。

sentences.english: He transacts business with a large number of stores.
sentences.chinese: 他與很多商店進行交易。

sentences.english: He pillaged the country of its treasures and of its best people.
sentences.chinese: 他掠奪了這個國家的財富和百姓中的精英。

sentences.english: Does Bruce see him as a left-winger or a central midfielder?
sentences.chinese: 布魯斯會把他當成一個左邊鋒還是中場球員？

sentences.english: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.
sentences.chinese: 正如，亞伯拉罕信神，這就算爲他的義。

sentences.english: I think he lives at No. 23 West Street, but I'm not sure about the number.
sentences.chinese: 我想他住在西大街23號，但是我對號碼不確定。

sentences.english: He came in, holding a cigarette between his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他嘴上叨着香菸走了進來。

sentences.english: He burst into the room red-faced and out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 他衝進房間，臉色通紅，氣喘吁吁。

sentences.english: He told me that I should have sold tickets.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴我，我必須賣票啊。

sentences.english: some drink from the fountain of knowledge, but he just gargled.
sentences.chinese: 人家暢飲智慧之泉，他只是拿來漱口了。

sentences.english: In this way Pingya's room had been fumigated before he was moved in.
sentences.chinese: 所以平亞搬進他的新屋子之前，也得要用煙燻。

sentences.english: He is a physically active, super—curious and highly inquisitive boy.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位體力活躍，非常好奇以及很好問的男孩。

sentences.english: However, Toni, who knows Ribery well, believes the Bianconeri should sign him.
sentences.chinese: 然而託尼很瞭解裏貝里，並且相信尤文會簽下他。

definition: to watch from a height or distance/to survey
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
